newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia not informed of Hashimoto cancelling trip.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia not informed of Hashimoto cancelling trip.

text.p: Malaysia's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday it had received no confirmation that Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto might cancel next month's trip to Malaysia and several neighbouring countries.

Earlier, Foreign Ministry officials in Japan said the prime minister might have to cancel a five-nation Southeast Asian tour scheduled from January 7 to 14 because of the hostage crisis at the Japanese Embassy residence in the Peruvian capital of Lima.

A Malaysian Foreign Ministry spokesman said preparations for Hashimoto's two-day visit, from January 8, would go on "until we get a confirmation", the national Bernama news agency reported on Thursday.
"As far as we are concerned, the visit is on...but I do understand that due to the hostage crisis in Peru, he may have to cancel his trip," the spokesman added.
Armed guerrillas continue to hold 104 hostages, including Malaysian Ambassador Ahmad Mokhtar, at the Japanese Embassy in Lima as the crisis entered its ninth day.
Hashimoto is also due to visit Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam and Brunei in January.
Also, Foreign Minister Yukihiko Ikeda might cancel a scheduled trip to Britain and India early next month, Japanese ministry officials said on Thursday.
Ikeda has already scrubbed a two-day trip to South Korea that was supposed to start on Friday.
